subject: Learning
title: Growth Mindset in Children
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Growth Mindset in Children.

hook.text: Tell a child 'you're so smart' and they avoid hard tasks. Tell them 'you worked so hard' and they seek challenges.

buildup.text: How adults praise children shapes whether they develop a fixed or growth mindset about their abilities.

discovery.text: Process praise ('great effort') builds growth mindset. Person praise ('you're so smart') builds fixed mindset.

twist.text: Children as young as 1 year old respond differently to process vs. person praise. The effect starts extremely early.

climax.text: School mindset interventionsâ€”brief lessons on brain plasticityâ€”improve grades, especially for struggling students.

punchline.text: Praise the process, not the person. That one shift changes everything.

quiz.question: What type of praise builds a growth mindset in children?
options: Process praise that acknowledges effort and strategy
Person praise that tells children they are smart
No praise at all is the most effective approach
